Identification_Area.title: MIMI Ion Neutral Camera for Cassini Orbiter

Modification_Detail.description: Updated schema version. LIDVID references updated to be LID references. Adding missing "investigation" references.
Initial version describing MIMI INCA as a unique instrument, rather than as a component of the MIMI instrument.

External_Reference.reference_text: Krimigis, S.M., D.G. Mitchell, D.C. Hamilton, S. Livi, J. Dandouras, S. Jaskulek, T.P. Armstrong, J.D. Boldt, A.F. Cheng, G. Gloeckler, J.R. Hayes, K.C. Hsieh, W.-H. Ip, E.P. Keath, E. Kirsch, N. Krupp, L.J. Lanzerotti, R. Lundgren, B.H. Mauk, R.W. McEntire, E.C. Roelof, C.E. Schlemm, B.E. Tossman, B. Wilken, and D.J. Williams, Magnetosphere Imaging Instrument (MIMI) on the Cassini Mission to Saturn/Titan, Space Sci Rev. 114, 233-329 (2004). https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-004-1410-8

Kusterer, M.B., L.M. Burke, Level 1A File Layouts, Cassini/MIMI Data Analysis Center Level 1A File Layouts, The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory Document, Revision 18, December 2003.
Manweiler, J.W., W.A. Rasmuss, and S. Joy, MIMI Standard Data Products and Archive Volume Software Interface Specification, v2.1, JPL Document D-31634, Cassini document IO-AR-006, 2005.

Instrument.name: MIMI Ion Neutral Camera for Cassini Orbiter
Instrument.description: The MIMI Ion Neutral Camera for Cassini Orbiter detects ions and neutral particles in Saturn’s magnetosphere. It helps to map the distribution and characteristics of these particles, contributing to our understanding of Saturn’s atmospheric dynamics and magnetospheric processes.
